means.word_mean: 刮或削下来的细屑,碎片,裂片,断片

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sc(e)afan 'scrape away the surface of (something) by paring', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schaven and German schaben

entry.def: When a man shaves, he removes the hair from his face using a razor or shaver so that his face is smooth.

example.ex: He took a bath and shaved before dinner...
example.tran: 晚餐前他洗了澡，刮了脸。

example.ex: He had shaved his face until it was smooth...
example.tran: 他把脸上的胡子刮得干干净净。

entry.def: If someone shaves a part of their body, they remove the hair from it so that it is smooth.

example.ex: If you have long curly hair, don't shave it off.
example.tran: 如果你有一头卷曲的长发，不要剪掉。

entry.def: If you shave someone, you remove the hair from their face or another part of their body so that it is smooth.

example.tran: 医生将他的头发剃去了。

example.ex: She had to call a barber to shave him.
example.tran: 她不得不叫个理发师来给他刮脸。

entry.def: If you shave off part of a piece of wood or other material, you cut very thin pieces from it.

example.ex: I set the log on the ground and shaved off the bark...
example.tran: 我将原木放到了地上，刨掉了树皮。

example.ex: She was shaving thin slices off a courgette.
example.tran: 她正将小胡瓜切成薄片。

entry.tran: (少量地)削减，缩减;使(略)有下降
entry.def: If you shave a small amount off something such as a record, cost, or price, you reduce it by that amount.

example.ex: She's already shaved four seconds off the national record for the mile...
example.tran: 她已经将一英里赛跑的国家纪录缩短了 4 秒。
超市连锁店已经稍稍降价。

entry.def: If you describe a situation as a close shave, you mean that there was nearly an accident or a disaster but it was avoided.

example.ex: I can't quite believe the close shaves I've had just recently.
example.tran: 我真是无法相信就在最近自己侥幸逃过了几场大难。
